channel.title: Alot Of Help Needed, Please Read... Any Help Will Do
channel.description:
Wel i recently just got myself a kool server but , im dumb and not very good with servers so, i need quite alot of help. As you log into the server i heard the way to change the name of the server at the top and in the chat box as you log in, is going on to client changing the names then using compile but i need to put what my java version is and i dont know how to find that out lol :o so could someone post a link to a good java download please so i can edit my server more, also i'd like to know how to make to change the NPC's in the server and what they say please
Also i'd like to add anottherr thing lol, as i load up the client im using it plays music and i tryed to add my songs onto it so when i load it up , it plays my songs. But it says the song files need to be compatible or something, Help please? :D

Guys , how do i make an npc say something and make it so the writing is always there?

item.title: Alot Of Help Needed, Please Read... Any Help Will Do
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Well, I’m not sure about adding you’re own personal music to the client but I can help you with shops. This is how it goes.

You open a file called ‘shops.CFG’ for starters. You’ll see it as just ‘shops’ but the correct term for that type of program is ‘.CFG’, you can identify a CFG file simply by looking at it, it’s a couple of squares, red, yellow, green and blue. Now, to start out you have to right click the file, select ‘Open With’ and then choose to open it with ‘Notepad’ or any other .txt program (Wordpad, Microsoft Word, etc). Then, check the box that says ‘Open files like this from now on’ or something, that way you won’t need to keep repeating this process.

Now, once you’ve done that, just double-click it and you should see something like this at the top

//-----ShopID---ShopName----------------------------------------Sell----Buy-----Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount--Item----Amount

Then, underneath that, there are several shops, they’ll look like this.

shop = 1	@whi@Miscellanious_Store			2	2	3751	100	3753	100	3755	100	3749	100	6737	25	6735	25	6731	25	6733	25	1131	1	7535	1	5574	100	5575	100	5576	100	88	25	3105	25	2579	25	2577	25	1205	10	1203	10	1207

Now, I think you should stick to modifying shops right now instead of adding them, no offense. Ok, now, to wipe a shop clean, simply delete everything in that line, instead, use this.

shop = 1	SHOP NAME HERE			2	2	ITEMID	AMOUNTOFITEM

Now, I’ll explain what each part is for.

shop = 1

This is just the shop number, this number is used in client.java aswell as shops.CFG, just so that the server knows which NPC is a shop and which isn’t. Just keep this the same for now, leave it as you find it.

SHOP NAME HERE

This (obviously) is the shop name, this appears at the top of the shop window whilst in trade with a shop keeper. Simply change that to whatever you wan’t to appear in-game! You can put things before the name, such as colours, here are some below.

@bla@
@blu@
@whi@
@red@
@gre@
@cya@
@pur@

The list goes on…

2	2

These two 2’s, decide whether any item can be sold to this shop or not. If you use 2’s, this means that only items sold from this specific shop can be sold back to it. Therefor if you put them 1’s, it means that any item can be sold back to this shop (depending on which item it is, some you can’t sell anyway). I suggest using 1’s for things like general stores and 2’s for dear stuff, like weapons.

ITEMID	AMOUNTOFITEM

Obviously here, first goes the item ID number and the 2nd goes the amount of that item. Item ID’s are found built in to the MoparScape client. To add more, just keep using this format.

And that’s all! Remember one thing ; USE THE TAB BUTTON FOR SPACING, NOT THE SPACEBAR!!

Hope I helped.

Read full topic
item.source: Alot Of Help Needed, Please Read... Any Help Will Do

item.title: Alot Of Help Needed, Please Read... Any Help Will Do
item.dc:creator: @X_Val_X X Val X
item.description:
@X_Val_X wrote:

The Mentor:

Double click compile.bat.

I do but it says i have 1 Error.

NPCHandler.java:949: cannot find symbol symbol : method randomICE<> location: class Item3 ItemHandler.addItem<Item3.randomICE<>, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID.absY, 1, tNpcKiller<NPCID>, false>; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

[br][size=1]Posted on: May 15, 2007, 10:46:29 AM[/size][hr]Btw it dosn’t say compile.bat

it just says compile. (im dumb with all this kinda stuff)[br][size=1]Posted on: May 15, 2007, 10:47:40 AM[/size][hr]OK im done with the java stuff now, how do i edit shops and put my own music on the client

Read full topic

item.title: Alot Of Help Needed, Please Read... Any Help Will Do
item.dc:creator: @X_Val_X X Val X
item.description:
@X_Val_X wrote:

Phew, i uninstalled my current java then installed it agian and it works now, but ANOTHER problem, well…just something i need to know, how do i compile. I edited the ‘client’ in notepad

I changed the skellexscape to ValentinePurePk , because i want it to say that at the top of the screen.

[code]//Skellexscape

import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import java.util.;
import java.text.*;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
//Playercount and server name at top of screen
public void writePlayers() {
int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();
sendFrame126("@cya@FeliXScapePkZ “, 6570);
sendFrame126(”@whi@Combat : " + combat, 6664);[/code]

Then i replaced the FeliXScapePkZ with ValentinePurePk because i want it to say it when you enter the server.
Now i need to compile it and idk how to …Can someone tell me?

Read full topic
